result.execSummary:
The defendant Denise L Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Ordinance Violation - Bail Jumping. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Denise L Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Denise L Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 16CM19 and 16CM27. Called 10:56 AM. State have reached a resolution. 16CM19 - enter plea to count 1 as alleged, 30 days in FC jail, costs. Count 2 amend to FC ordinance of BJ, $500 fine plus costs. 16CM27 - plea to all 3 counts. Count 1 - 60 days (consecutive) in FC jail, costs. Counts 2 & 3 - $300 fine plus costs on each count. Court amends count 2 in 16CM19 to FC ordinance of BJ. DE pleads NC. Court accepts plea and adjudges guilty, imposes fine of $500 fine plus costs, 60 DTP/CO. 16CM19 - Count 1  - defendant pleads NC. 16CM27 - Counts 1, 2 & 3 defendant pleads NC. Court has PLQ and goes over it with defendant, finds she is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering her plea, waiving her constitutional rights and right to trial. Court accepts plea and adjudges guilty of count 1 in Case 16CM19, counts 1, 2 & 3 in case 16CM27. State makes final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation, 84 days of jail credit. Daniels makes statement, remorseful. Court accepts joint recommendation and sentences to the following: 16CM19 - Count 1 - imposes 30 days in the FC jail with huber and good time, imposes costs with 60 DTP/CO. 16CM27 - Count 1 - imposes 60 days in FC jail with huber and good time, consecutive to count 1 in case 16CM19, imposes costs with 60 DTP/CO. Counts 2 & 3 - imposes fine of $300 plus costs on each count, 60 DTP/CO. 84 days jail credit. DNA and surcharges on each count. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2017 at 10:15 am.
Jury trial on November 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Denise L Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Denise L Daniels in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:38 AM. Called 16CM19 and 16M27. State - here to set matter for JT and to set bond. Court reviews cases. Court sets both matters for JT. State - bond - $5000.00 cash on each case. Joy - bond - $1000.00 cash each case. Court - bond - $5000.00 cash on each case.  Jury trial scheduled for November 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on August 31, 2017 at 09:15 am.
Arrested FOSO

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:04 PM. Called 16CM19 and 16CM27. Joy has lost contact with his client. State asks for forfeiture of any bonds posted and bench warrant, body or $1,000.00. Court so orders.
Status conference on November 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
State
Jury trial on November 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on September 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Denise L Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Defendant Denise L Daniels in custody who appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:34 AM. Called 16CM19 and 16CM27. Joy has complaints and has gone over them with the defendant, waives further reading of them, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas and set both matters for FPT. State asks for bond as ordered on warrants for stated reasons. Joy asks for lower cash bond or signature bond, for stated reasons. Defendant states that her address is in Milwaukee but will be staying in Crandon with her sister for a while for stated reasons (5616 Wej me gek Court, Crandon) . Court - bond - 16CM19 - $375.00 cash on each case (total bond of $750.00) - with same conditions of no consumption of alcohol.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.
arrested FOSO

Defendant Denise L Daniels not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:28 AM. State asks for bench warrant, body or $100 more than the bond on each case. Court forfeits any bond posted and issues bench warrant, or $1000.00 on each case. Track traffic.
Initial appearance on April 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Judge quashed warrant, re-instates $300 cash bond that is currently posted but ordered forefeited.
